business.headline: Titan share price jumps over 4% after strong Q4 numbers. Should you buy?Titan's share price surged 4.95% to reach the day's high of Rs 3,530 on the BSE, compared to the previous close of Rs 3,363.45.

Drone stocks light up Dalal Street, rally up to 17% amid Indo-Pak tensionsShares of ideaforge Technology jumped nearly 17% to Rs 450 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE) after Indian forces deployed suicide drones to neutralise air defence systems in Lahore and Multan. Meanwhile, Droneacharya gained 5%, ZEN Technologies advanced 5%, and Paras Defence rose almost 5% in intraday trade.

India likely to caution IMF against fresh financial support to Pakistan: ReportIndia seems to be sending a message that simply handing out money to Pakistan won't solve the deeper issues, especially when terrorism and poor handling of previous funds remain concerns.

HAL, BEL, Bharat Dynamics: Defence stocks rally up to 7% amid Indo-Pak tensionsShares of Hindustan Aeronautics (HAL), Bharat Dynamics (BDL), Bharat Electronics Ltd (BEL), and Paras Defence jumped between 2 and 7% in Friday's trade, outperforming a jittery broader market shaken by geopolitical uncertainty.

India-Pakistan tension: What should investors do as Sensex, Nifty trade in red?At 9:43 am, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen by 507.64 points to 79,827.17, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 160 points to 24,113.80. Most shares and sectors were trading lower, with only a few managing to stay in the green.

Markets volatile but no crash on D-Street amid Indo-Pak tensions. 3 things to knowThe Sensex dropped over 500 points within minutes, and the Nifty wasn't far behind. But despite the panic-inducing headlines, the market didn't spiral into chaos.
Market opens volatile amid India-Pakistan tension; Sensex down over 500 pointsSensex falls 500 points, Nifty falls as Indo-Pak tensions spook Dalal Street

Stock market LIVE: Sensex down 500 points, Nifty regains 24,100 markShare market LIVE: Investor sentiment has been dampened by rising border tensions between India and Pakistan as Dalal Street has taken a hit. However, experts have cautioned against panic selling.

Stock market opening: Will Sensex, Nifty crash today amid Indo-Pak tension?Gift Nifty futures were trading at 23,987 as of 6:46 am, which suggests that the Nifty50 could open nearly 1.2% below Thursday's close of 24,273.8.

Stocks to watch today: HAL, Swiggy, Titan, Zee, MCX, Bharat Forge, L&TDefence sector stocks such as Hindustan Aeronautics Ltd (HAL), Bharat Forge, and Bharat Dynamics Ltd (BDL) are likely to remain in focus.

EPFO to speed up higher pension applications, payouts likely by year-end: ReportThe EPFO has received about 1.75 million applications from pensioners who want to get a higher pension based on their actual wages, out of a total of 7.8 million pensioners.

Explained: Why Sensex, Nifty fell sharply moments before stock market closingBy market close, the BSE Sensex had dropped 411.97 points to 80,334.81, while the Nifty 50 fell 140.60 points to 24,273.80. The India VIX, often seen as the market's fear gauge, spiked over 10 per cent to cross the 21 mark—its highest since early April.

entertainment.headline: Neha Kakkar and husband Rohanpreet attend their driver's wedding. WatchSinger Neha Kakkar and Rohanpreet Singh were seen attending their driver's wedding in Mumbai, celebrating warmly with guests and the family. This heartfelt gesture video comes amid ongoing controversy surrounding Kakkar's Melbourne concert delay.

Rajkummar Rao's middle-class mojo, and making of the common man's kingRajkummar Rao's acting is deeply rooted in his middle-class background, making his characters feel incredibly real and relatable to the Indian audience. With his upcoming film 'Bhool Chuk Maaf' releasing soon, fans eagerly await to see yet another authentic portrayal that resonates like a familiar face from everyday life.

Chiranjeevi wants Ram Charan, Janhvi Kapoor for Jagadeka Veerudu sequelThe hit 1990 Telugu film 'Jagadeka Veerudu Athiloka Sundari' re-released on May 9. Ahead of that, megastar Chiranjeevi expressed his wish to see his son Ram Charan and Sridevi's daughter Janhvi Kapoor in a potential sequel to the film.

Kangana Ranaut makes Hollywood debut with horror film Blessed be the Evil. DetailsKangana Ranaut has teamed up with Sylvester Stallone's daughter, Scarlett Rose Stallone, for a horror drama in Hollywood. The film will be presented to the buyers at the Cannes International Film Festival this year.

Malayalam actor Vinayakan arrested for creating nuisance under alcohol influenceMalayalam actor Vinayakan was arrested for causing a disturbance under the influence of alcohol at a hotel in Kerala. He was later released on bail after a case was registered under the Kerala Police Act.
Arijit Singh postpones Abu Dhabi concert amid India-Pakistan tensionsSinger Arijit Singh has postponed his upcoming concert in Abu Dhabi in light of the tense situation between India and Pakistan.

Shameful: Rupali Ganguly blasts Fawad Khan for his post on Operation SindoorActor Rupali Ganguly got the support of Indian social media users as she slammed Pakistani actor Fawad Khan for his working association with India.

Kangana Ranaut to Vir Das, celebs salute Indian army's valour: You are our heroesAmid rising tensions between India and Pakistan and a series of missile attacks in the past 24 hours, several celebrities have praised the bravery of the Indian Army and offered prayers for those living near the border.

Actor Ravi Mohan makes an appearance with singer Kenishaa amid his divorceActor Ravi Mohan made an appearance with singer Kenishaa Francis, his rumoured girlfriend, at producer Ishari Ganesh's daughter's wedding in Chennai. This came amid his divorce with ex-wife Aarti.

Fifty Shades, House of Cards director James Foley dies of brain cancer at 71American filmmaker James Foley, best known for the Fifty Shades films, died earlier this week. He was battling brain cancer.

Kantara makers say junior artiste did not die on film set, offer condolencesThe makers of Rishab Shetty's 'Kantara: Chapter 1' cleared the air surrounding the death of junior artiste MF Kapil. In a statement, they offered condolences to his family and friends.

Samay Raina salutes armed forces as he recalls call from his father in JammuStand-up comedian Samay Raina described his late-night call with his father in Jammu as 'calm'. He also expressed his admiration and respect for the Indian Armed Forces.

Country star Cody Johnson announces Baby No. 3 at 2025 ACM AwardsCountry singer Cody Johnson announced at the 2025 ACM Awards that he and wife Brandi are expecting their third child — a boy — sharing the news during a gender reveal onstage.

Doja Cat, Sabrina Carpenter and Luke Combs to perform at ACL Festival 2025Austin City Limits Festival 2025 returns to Zilker Park with a stellar lineup including Doja Cat and Hozier. Three-day GA passes sold out fast; premium ticket options remain available.

ACM Awards 2025: How to stream the show live on Amazon Prime Video and TwitchThe ACM Awards 2025, hosted by Reba McEntire, will feature star-studded performances, including Rascal Flatts with Backstreet Boys and Chris Stapleton. Stream it live for free on Amazon Prime Video and Twitch.

Jennifer Aniston stalker ordered to undergo mental evaluation after gate crashA man accused of stalking Jennifer Aniston and ramming his car into her Bel Air gate has been ordered to undergo a mental evaluation after years of alleged harassment and felony charges.

From Austin to Stockholm: Full schedule for 2025 Ultrasound world tourPop star Lorde returns with her album Virgin on June 27, 2025, followed by the Ultrasound Tour across North America, the UK, and Europe. Tickets go on sale May 16.

Gram Chikitsalay review: Amol Parashar adds life to this tale of healing and hopeReleased-Fri May 09, 2025Gram Chikitsalay series review: The TVF series set in rural Jharkhand, features a young doctor's earnest struggle to win the trust of villagers who prefer a local quack. With sincere performances and authentic storytelling, the show beautifully captures the challenges and hope. It also highlights the real need for a change in the neglected healthcare sector.

Sonu Nigam, Arijit Singh to recreate Sandese Aate Hai song  for Border 2: ReportSonu Nigam and Arijit Singh will recreate the patriotic song 'Sandese Aate Hai' for 'Border 2.' T-Series has acquired the rights of the iconic song for Rs 10 crore, making it the most expensive Bollywood song remake to date.

general news.headline:
Live:  PM tracked, monitored Pakistan's missile offensive throughout the nightOperation Sindoor, India Pakistan Tension News Live Updates: On Thursday, Pakistan launched a series of missiles and drone attacks targeting several regions in India, including Jammu, Rajasthan, and Punjab. All incoming threats were successfully thwarted by India's defence forces, preventing large-scale damage and loss of life.
The provocation came just a day after India carried out precision strikes on terror camps located in Pakistan and Pakistan-occupied Kashmir, in retaliation to the Pahalgam terror attack. As tensions flared, Pakistan attempted to strike back by launching a barrage of missiles and deploying drones across the Line of Control and international borders.
India's response was swift and effective. The country's air defence systems intercepted at least eight incoming missiles, while fighter jets shot down a Pakistani F-16 and possibly two JF-17 aircraft.

Security forces kill 7 suspected Jaish terrorists in J&K's Samba: SourcesThe infiltration bid came on a day when India neutralised Pakistan military's attempt to hit military stations in Jammu, Pathankot, Udhampur and some other locations with missiles and drones as tensions soared between the two countries amid fears of a wider military conflict.

Pakistan Supreme Court strengthens army chief Asim Munir's handsEven as Pakistan reels after India's Operation Sindoor and the counterstrike after its aerial attack, its Supreme Court handed the Army, led by the unpopular General Asim Munir, a potent new weapon. Now, civilians can be tried in military courts in Pakistan. The judiciary has effectively approved a military crackdown on dissent, just when Munir needed it the most.

Heavy losses: Pak ministry's X account seeks loans, government claims it's hackedPakistan's Economic Affairs Ministry said its X account had been hacked after a post, appealing to international partners for more loans and helping to de-escalate rising tensions with India.
How Indian interceptors crushed Pak drones: Inside the air defence webThe night sky came to life with the roar of multiple interceptors from India that turned the Pakistani drones into duds.

Air sirens in Chandigarh, residents asked to stay indoors amid tensions with PakThe Chandigarh administration on Friday sounded an air raid siren, urging residents to remain indoors amid rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

Missile, debris, shells found in Punjab's Hoshiarpur, Bathinda amid Pak attackMissile, debris and shells were found in Punjab's Hoshiarpur and Bathinda as India continued to foiled Pakistan's attempt to attack border areas.

Fitting reply: Army shares 1st visual of destroying Pak military post along LoCThe Indian Army neutralised over 50 swarm drones launched by Pakistan during a large-scale counter-drone operation in the areas of Udhampur, Samba, Jammu, Akhnoor, Nagrota (all in Jammu and Kashmir) and Pathankot (Punjab).

Pak fires missiles by night, fake videos by day in coordinated social media warAs India continues to repel Pakistan's back-to-back drone and missile attacks, pro-Islamabad accounts flooded social media with doctored videos, false claims, and old war footage, sparking a full-blown digital disinformation offensive.

Abdul Rauf Azhar, IC-814 hijacking mastermind, killed in Op Sindoor: BJPBJP's post claimed that along with Rauf, an additional 14 members of Jaish chief Masood Azhar's family were killed in Operation Sindoor.

JD Vance says US won't intervene in India-Pakistan dispute: None of our businessUS Vice President JD Vance has ruled out American intervention in the India-Pakistan conflict, calling it "none of our business" and urging both sides to pursue de-escalation through diplomacy.

India-Pakistan tension: What should investors do as Sensex, Nifty trade in red?At 9:43 am, the S&P BSE Sensex had fallen by 507.64 points to 79,827.17, while the NSE Nifty50 dropped 160 points to 24,113.80. Most shares and sectors were trading lower, with only a few managing to stay in the green.

Feeling anxious amid Indo-Pak tensions? How to calm yourself downWhile the full outcome of the India-Pakistan standoff remains uncertain, the growing sense of instability can spark worry among civilians, especially those with existing mental health problems like anxiety and depression.

We are at war with terrorists: Indian envoy to US on India-Pak tensionsIndia's envoy to the US, Vinay Kwatra, said the April 22 Pahalgam attack was the original escalation when four Pak-backed terrorists carried out brutal killings of 26 civilians.

New Delhi, Islamabad have had contacts at NSC level, says Pakistan's US envoyPakistan's US envoy Rizwan Sheikh told CNN that India and Pakistan have had contacts at the NSC level, amid rising tensions. As cross-border attacks intensify, the US has urged both nations to de-escalate and resume direct dialogue.

Employee puts up 'stop crying before returning to work' sticker in washroom, fired"Got fired because of a sticker," read the title of the Reddit post in which the employee explained that they had placed a sticker above a mirror in the washroom that read: "Employees must stop crying before returning to work."

Kangana Ranaut makes Hollywood debut with horror film Blessed be the Evil. DetailsKangana Ranaut has teamed up with Sylvester Stallone's daughter, Scarlett Rose Stallone, for a horror drama in Hollywood. The film will be presented to the buyers at the Cannes International Film Festival this year.

Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 is here: Transform your garden with upto 60% off on lawn & garden essentialsMake your Garden and Lawn summer ready with Amazon India's Great Summer Sale 2025 that is live now. Enjoy Up to 60% off on Lawn & Garden Essentials such as Plants, Solar Lights and more.

Bill Gates says Elon Musk killing children with his work with DOGEMicrosoft co-founder Bill Gates has accused Elon Musk of harming children in the world's poorest countries by cutting foreign aids in his role as DOGE head.

Can't break up? A therapist might help you do it rightWhen the thought of having that difficult break-up conversation leaves you jittery — or the fear of your partner's reaction makes you break into a sweat — reaching out to a therapist can provide much-needed support.

With sincere performances and authentic storytelling, the show beautifully captures the challenges and hope. It also highlights the real need for a change in the neglected healthcare sector.

What is drone warfare? A simple explainer amid India-Pakistan tensionsDrone warfare is now transforming the way nations wage wars. During the recent India-Pakistan tensions, drones were employed to attack targets without deploying soldiers across the border. This method of warfare has been witnessed earlier -- in Ukraine, Israel, and elsewhere in the world.

Pope Leo XIV is first pope with big internet presence and his X feed reveals quite a lotLooking at his social media activity, it comes as no surprise that Pope Leo XIV has a keen interest in social and political matters.

sports.headline: LSG vs RCB Preview: Predicted XI, team news and Ekana pitch conditionsLSG vs RCB, IPL 2025 Preview: Despite heightened national tensions, IPL chairman Arun Dhumal confirmed LSG vs RCB will go on as planned in Lucknow on May 9, setting up a must-win clash for Pant's men and a playoff boost for Bengaluru.

Rishabh Pant needs to go back to basics: Navjot Sidhu decodes LSG skipper's struggleFormer India cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu believes Lucknow Super Giants captain Rishabh Pant needs to go back to basics to resurrect his batting form in the ongoing Indian Premier League (IPL) 2025.

Mason Mount's positive route to United brace vs Bilbao: Knew good would comeMason Mount credited his return to form to a positive mindset and hard work after his match-winning brace helped Manchester United cruise past Athletic Bilbao and into the Europa League final with a 7-1 aggregate win.

Cricket Australia awaits call on IPL 2025 amid India, Pakistan tensionCricket Australia was closely monitoring the escalating tensions in the region on Friday, with several of its players and coaches currently participating in the Indian Premier League.

With a replacement spree, are teams looking to build for next season?IPL 2025: Teams like Chennai Super Kings and Sunrisers Hyderabad have gone for replacement players to modify their squad and be better prepared for the next season of the tournament.

Rishabh Pant never under pressure: Mayank Yadav on struggling LSG skipperLSG pace sensation Mayank Yadav backed skipper Rishabh Pant amid widespread criticism, insisting the under-fire wicketkeeper-batter never shows signs of pressure despite enduring a tough run with the bat in IPL 2025.

RCB pacer Yash Dayal follows his process to reap rewards as death bowlerRoyal Challengers Bengaluru (RCB) medium pacer Yash Dayal has established himself as one of the top death-over bowlers in the Indian Premier League (IPL). Neeraj Chopra to compete at Ostrava Golden Spike 2025Neeraj Chopra is set to finally compete at the prestigious Ostrava Golden Spike 2025 in the Czech Republic on June 24, after missing the last two editions due to injury setbacks.

Manchester United set up Europa League final with Tottenham after thumping BilbaoManchester United thumped Athletic Bilbao 4-1 at Old Trafford to secure their spot in the final of the UEFA Europa League on Thursday, May 8. Tottenham Hotspur will face United in the final as they overcame Bodo/Glimt in the other semi-final clash.

Abhinav Bindra extends gratitude to Indian army as Pakistan escalates tensionsLegendary Indian shooter and Olympic gold medallist Abhinav Bindra has extended gratitude to the Indian armed forces amid the rising border tensions with Pakistan.

An eye for eye makes world blind: Ambati Rayudu amid escalating India-Pak tensionFormer India cricketer Ambati Rayudu shared his thoughts on the escalating tensions between India and Pakistan, praying for peace and safety in 'Jammu and Kashmir, Punjab and other parts of India along the border'.

Evacuation without panic: How fans exited Dharamsala stadium after IPL match called offThe security officials did a splendid job during the evacuation process at the Himachal Pradesh Cricket Association Stadium after the PBKS vs DC game was called off on Thursday, May 7 after the attacks from Pakistan in various parts of India. A fan present at the game spoke to India Today about the evacuation process and how the incidents transpired on Thursday.

When was the PBKS vs DC clash in Dharamsala called off?IPL 2025: The Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals clash at the HPCA Stadium in Dharamsala was called off amid Pakistan attacking several locations in Jammu, including the airport.

IPL 2025: Special train arranged to get PBKS, DC players from Dharamshala to DelhiA special train has been arranged by the BCCI to get the Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals players and staff from Dharamshala to Delhi after the match between the two teams in the city was cancelled after attacks from Pakistan in various parts of India.

IPL match called off in Dharamsala amid Pak attack, players rushed outThe IPL 2025 match between Punjab Kings and Delhi Capitals has been called off in Dharamshala amidst Pakistan's attack in various parts of India. Players and spectators were rushed out of the HImachal Pradesh Cricket ASsociation Stadium.

PBKS vs DC: Delhi bring in Madhav Tiwari in place of Vipraj Nigam for must win clashDelhi Capitals (DC) rested Vipraj Nigam to bring in Madhav Tiwari for Match 58 of the Indian Premier League 2025 (IPL 2025) against Punjab Kings (PBKS) in Dharamsala. The management also dropped Karun Nair for the fixture.

Knew Rohit Sharma would be a great captain when I was in BCCI: Sourav GangulyFormer India captain Sourav Ganguly recently said that he always knew that Rohit Sharma would turn out to be a great captain when he was the President of the BCCI (Board of Control for Cricket in India).

IPL 2025: PBKS vs MI match on May 11 shifted from Dharamshala to AhmedabadThe match between Punjab Kings and Mumbai Indians on May 11 has been officially shifted from Dharamshala to Ahmedabad. The match will start at its scheduled time of 3:30 pm IST on Sunday at the Narendra Modi stadium.

Pakistan postpones PSL match in Rawalpindi Stadium after India's counter-strikesThe Pakistan Cricket Board confirmed the postponement of Thursday's PSL 2025 match after a drone struck the Rawalpindi Cricket Stadium. The future of PSL is in doubt amid the rising tensions between India and Pakistan.

CSK stint felt like an internship: GT's Sai Kishore on time with 5-time IPL championsGT spinner Sai Kishore said that his time with CSK felt like an internship for him and helped him shape the way he sees the game. Kishore spent two years with CSK before joining GT during the IPL 2022 auction.

PBKS vs DC Highlights: Punjab Kings vs Delhi Capitals match called offIPL 2025, PBKS vs DC Highlights: Punjab Kings are dominating things in Dharamshala as Priyansh Arya gets to his fifty off just 25 balls. Prabhsimran Singh is playing a solid hand at the moment at the other end.

Shubman Gill's fitting tribute to Rohit Sharma: Will remember your learnings foreverStar India batter Shubman Gill paid tribute to Rohit Sharma following his retirement from Tests on May 7. Rohit scored 4301 runs in the longest format and also captained the team in 24 games.

Rohit Sharma's Test retirement his own call, no pressure from BCCI: Rajiv ShuklaBCCI vice-president Rajiv Shukla has said that Rohit Sharma's Test retirement was the 38-year-old's call and the cricket board didn't pressurise him into making the decision. Rohit retired from Test cricket on May 7.

Jannik Sinner comeback: When and where to watch World No.1 in Italian OpenItalian Open 2025: World No.1 Jannik Sinner will make his comeback on May 9 when he faces the winner of the match between Federico Cina and Mariano Navone.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
